title: Delta variant hits Taiwan, controversies on vaccines and testing; CCP: DPP creates disorder in HK to plot for independence

Last week, aside from the pandemic, CCP propaganda included reproaching the â€œDPP authorityâ€ for â€œcreating disorder in Hongkong to plot for independence.â€ On June 24th, Hongkongâ€™s Apple Daily was forced to close. A narrative appeared on Facebook criticising the DPP for â€œhaving double standards regarding the closing of Hongkongâ€™s Apple Daily and Taiwanâ€™s CTITV.â€ According to IORGâ€™s database, there were 47 related Facebook posts between June 21st and 27th. The earliest post was found from the Facebook page of KMT Disciplinary Committee. Chinese state media Tong Shuo and pro-China content farm The Reacher echoed the same narrative.

Confirmed cases of the Delta variants in Pingtung County have attracted public attention and resurfaced the debate around universal testing for all inbound travellers (å…¥å¢ƒæ™®ç¯©). IORG has found 244 Facebook posts of this narrative between June 21st and 27th and 6 occurrences of â€œclustered posting,â€ sharing content such as articles from the content farm Mission (å¯†è¨Š) and Fong News (æºé¢¨å ±). In our last Weekly, IORG has referenced a report by The Reporter in 2019, exposing Missionâ€™s Chinese connections and its â€œresurrectionâ€ with the new domain pplomo.com after being banned by Facebook in the same year.

Regarding Taiwan-made vaccines, 2 narratives have been identified in this Weekly â€“ â€œMedigen vaccine production is like a home factory,â€ â€œAn American-Taiwanese cockroach syndicate is manipulating UBI Asiaâ€™s stock for personal gain.â€ According to IORGâ€™s database, the former narrative originated from a CTI YouTube video, which altered a video from CNN and added Chinese text overlay such as â€œfailure to wear face mask during vaccine inspection,â€ inconsistent with the original report. This is an example of distorted content, a type of content manipulation. The later narrative originated from a Facebook post by Taiwanese commentator Huang Chih-hsien (é»ƒæ™ºè³¢). The post is built on a previous suspicious narrative that â€œBlackwater invested in UBI Asia vaccine R&Dâ€ and further claims that there is â€œan American-Taiwanese cockroach syndicateâ€ â€œmanipulating UBI Asiaâ€™s stock for personal gain.â€ Chinese state media Straits Today (ä»Šæ—¥æµ·å³½) shared Huangâ€™s post.

3 claims in CTI video regarding Medigen vaccine production, clarifications from Medigen, editorâ€™s opinion from Cofacts, and fact-checking from IORG. Source: CTI, announcement by Medigen via MOPS, TWSE, 2021/6/27 15:30, Cofactsã€CNN. Table by IORG.

Furthermore, the narrative that â€œdark figures cause high mortality rate in Taiwanâ€ requires further scientific verification. It is IORGâ€™s opinion that both Taipei City Mayor Ko Wen-je (æŸ¯æ–‡å“²) and Taiwanâ€™s Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) have yet to provide a clear description and verifiable evidence. However, Chinese state media Haiwai Net (æµ·å¤–ç¶²) and Global Times (ç’°çƒç¶²) both reported on Mayor Koâ€™s statement on June 24th.

In Weekly No. 2, IORG has introduced the false narrative â€œTaiwanese pork products tested excessive ractopamine in Hongkongâ€ initiated by Chinese state media Hongkong Wonweipo (é¦™æ¸¯æ–‡åŒ¯å ±), which might cause public concerns regarding Taiwanees pork and have an effect on the August referendums. In this Weekly, another false narrative targeting Taiwanese pork was identified. â€œDo not eat sick Taiwanese porkâ€ was being spread with an audio file and a picture. This narrative has been verified by Taiwan Fact-check Center as false.

Full version of this Dokidoki Alert Weekly is available in Taiwanese Mandarin. Please visit https://iorg.tw/da/4 for more...
